content: If you become aware of animal cruelty in the UK, you should contact the RSPCA (Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals) immediately. They have a 24-hour cruelty line that you can call to report any incidents of animal abuse. You can also report cruelty to the police. If you wish to remain anonymous, you can contact the RSPCA's inspectorate appeal line. If you are unable to contact the RSPCA, you can also contact the local authorities in your area.
